src_text: Tindzaba Letibalulekile Telive1.
trg_text: Messages1.

src_text: Kutfolakala kwemanti
trg_text: Water security

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ibonge bantfu baseNingizimu Afrika ngekutfobela imibandzela yemanti lesetjentiswe etindzaweni letitsite taseJozi, taseTshwane netase-Ekurhuleni kute kusimamiswe linani lemanti lasemadamin Emadamu netilulu temanti tisaloku ticindzetelekile ngenca yemazinga ekushisa lasetulu eGauteng, futsi kukhula kwesidzingo semanti kuphocelele i-Rand Water kutsi inciphise kakhulu kuphakelwa kwemanti kubomasipal Lesikhungo lesilusito sekuphakela emanti siphakela emanti ekunatsa ngebunyenti ebantfwini labangetulu kwetigidzi leti-11 eGauteng, etincenyeni letitsite teMpumalanga, eFreyistata naseNyakatfo Nshonalang
trg_text: Cabinet thanked South Africans for adhering to water restrictions implemented in certain parts of Johannesburg, Tshwane and Ekurhuleni to stabilise the capacity of reservoir Dams and reservoirs remain under pressure due to high temperatures in Gauteng, and increasing demand forced Rand Water to reduce water supply to municipalities drasticall The water utility supplies bulk potable water to more than 11 million people in Gauteng, parts of Mpumalanga, the Free State and North Wes

src_text: Lemibandzela lengavimbeleki ihlose kuvikela kutfolakala kwemanti futsi itawuhlala ikhona site simo sibe ncon Ikhabhinethi icela ummango kutsi uchubeke nekutfobela lemibandzela yemanti nekutsi udlale indzima yekutsi usebentise lensita leyimvela kancane ngendlela leyongako
trg_text: These unavoidable restrictions aim to secure water supply and will remain in place until the situation improve Cabinet called on the public to continue adhering to the water restrictions and play their part by using this scarce resource sparingly

src_text: Siteleka sase-Transnet
trg_text: Transnet strike

src_text: Ikhabhinethi iyasamukela lesivumelwano semiholo seminyaka lemitsatfu lesisemkhatsini kwe-Transnet nenyonyane yebasebenti i-United National Transport Union (i-UNTU), lesitawusebenta kusuka mhla lu-1 Mabasa 2022 kuya kumhla tinge-31 Indlovulenkhulu 2025.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the three-year wage deal reached between Transnet and the United National Transport Union (UNTU), which is applicable for the period 1 April 2022 to 31 March 2025.

src_text: Ikhomishini Yekubuyisana, Yekungenelela Neyekulamula beyengamele lomhlangano lote nalesivumelwano, locedze lesiteleka samanje semalunga e-UNTU ngaleso sikhats Ikhabhinethi iphindze yasemukela sincumo se-South African Transport and Allied Workers (i-SATAWU) sekucedza lesitelek
trg_text: The Commission for Conciliation, Mediation and Arbitration mediated this deal, which ended the current industrial action by members of UNTU with immediate effec Cabinet also welcomed the decision by the South African Transport and Allied Workers Union to call off the strik

src_text: Ikhabhinethi iyakwamukela lokutibophelela kwe-Transnet ekutseni itawugcila kakhulu ekususeni kusilela emuva lokwenteke kuto tonkhe tikhumulo temikhumbi nasemizileni yetitimela ngalesikhatsi salesiteleka, lokube nemtselela lomubi kutemnotfo nakumikhakha lencike kulemisebent
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the commitment by Transnet to focus on clearing backlogs that occurred across the port and rail system during the industrial action, which negatively impacted the economy and sectors that are dependent on its service

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ibonge kakhulu lokwesekelwa nekubambisana lokuniketwe betemabhizinisi ngalesikhatsi salesitelek Igcugcutela kutsi buchubeke lobudlelwane lobusemkhatsini kwebaphatsi nebasebenti base-Transnet kute lenkampani netemnotfo tikhone kuzuza
trg_text: It encourages a continuous relationship between Transnet management and labour for the benefit of the company and the economy of the country

src_text: Budlelwane emkhatsini kweNingizimu Afrika neSaudi Arabia
trg_text: Saudi Arabia relations

src_text: Ikhabhinethi iyakwemukela kuhamba kwaMengameli Cyril Ramaphosa lokube yimphumelelo Ayovakashela Ngekwemsebenti Bukhosi baseSaudi Arabia mhla ti-15 namhla ti-16 Imphala 2022.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the successful Working Visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia by President Cyril Ramaphosa on 15 and 16 October 2022.

src_text: Kulokuvakasha, lamave lamabili asayine tivumelwano tekusebentisana (ema-MoU) leti-17 kumikhakha lehlukahlukene lefana netekulima, tekudvweba, tetimbiwa, temandla lavikela simondzawo, tekuvikela, tekutfutsa netekulima ngetitjalo nangetilwane tasemantin Letinye tivumelwano letisayiniwe timayelana nekusungula Umkhandlu Wetemabhizinisi Lohlangene, kusebentisana kumkhakha wetetimboni tetetimphi netekutsengiselana, kanye nekusebentisana kutesayensi lemayelana nekuhlola ematje nemhlab
trg_text: During the visit, the two countries signed 17 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) in various fields such as agriculture, fisheries, mining, renewable energy, security, transport and aquacultur Other MoUs signed are on the establishment of a Joint Business Council, cooperation in the field of military industries and procurements, and on geological survey cooperatio

src_text: Mengameli usebentise lokuvakasha kumema bosomabhizinisi baseSaudi Arabia kutsi bete eNingizimu Afrika kulenkhomfa yesihlanu Yekutjala timali letawubanjwa ngemnyaka we-2023.
trg_text: The President used the visit to invite Saudi Arabia businesses to South Africa s fifth investment conference that will be held in 2023.

src_text: I-Saudi Arabia ingumlingani weNingizimu Afrika wesibili ngebukhulu kutekuhwebelana kulesigodzi saseMphumalanga Lemaphakatsi futsi ihamba embili ekutsengeni tintfo letibuya kulesigodz Budlelwane betemave emhlaba emkhatsini walamave lamabili bente kutsi kube nemtselela lomuhle kutekuhwebelana netelutjalomal 4.
trg_text: Saudi Arabia is South Africa s second largest trading partner in the Middle East and the largest source of imports from the regio International relations between both countries have resulted in a positive effect on trade and investment trends

src_text: Kutjala Timali Kusakhiwonchanti
trg_text: Infrastructure investment

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ivumile kutsi kusungulwe imboni lesezingeni lemhlaba lekhicita iplasitiki lekutawentiwa yimboni lehamba embili emhlabeni, i-ALPLA Group, eLanseria eGauten
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the commissioning of a state-of-the-art plastics production plant by leading international manufacturer, the ALPLA Group, at Lanseria in Gauten

src_text: Loku kucinisa kutibophelela kwaMengameli Ramaphosa ekubekeni kutfutfukisa sakhiwonchanti njengendlela yekuvuselela kukhulisa umnotfo neyekukhulisa ematfuba emisebent
trg_text: This augments President Ramaphosa s commitment to position infrastructure development as a means to stimulate the economy and increase employmen

src_text: Lolutjalomali lolubita imali letigidzi leti-50 temadola aseMelika lufaka ligalelo lelimcoka kuloluhlelo lolukhulu lwekwakhiwa kwelidolobha i-Lanseria Smart City lolutawuhambisa embili kusimama kwenta imikhicito lemisha ngetintfo lesetilahliwe kanye nekwakha kuphindze futsi kusekelwe ematfuba emisebenti lenge-350.
trg_text: The investment worth US$50 million is a key contribution to the Lanseria Smart City masterplan that will drive sustainability and recycling as well as create and sustain 350 job Included is an apprenticeship programme for 36 mechatronics and recycling technicians for ALPLA Group operations across southern Afric The apprentice programme will commence in 2023, with the first 12 South African apprentices coming from local communities

src_text: Lokunye lokutawuba khona luhlelo lwekucecesha bafundzi labange-36 babe bonjiniyela bemishini yebucwepheshe nekuba bocwepheshe bekwenta imikhicito lemisha ngetintfo lesetilahliwe be-ALPLA Group leyenta umsebenti kuso sonkhe sigodzi lesingaseningizimu kwe-Afrik Loluhlelo lwekuceceshwa ufundza lutawucala ngemnyaka we-2023, lapho khona bafundzi labatawucala kuceceshwa laba-12 baseNingizimu Afrika batawutsatfwa emimangweni yakuleyondzawo
trg_text: The Fifth District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo in Upington, Northern Cape will take place on Friday, 21 October 2022 at the local Mxolisi Dicky Jacobs Stadiu

src_text: Kumbiwa kwetimbiwa lokungekho emtsetfweni
trg_text: Illegal mining

src_text: Kumbiwa kwetimbiwa lokungekho emtsetfweni kulimata imimango netemnotfo, futsi kubanga kutsi kulahleke imalingena kuhulumende nakumkhakha wetetimayin
trg_text: Illegal mining hurts communities and our economy, and results in a loss of revenue for both government and the mining secto

src_text: Ikhabhinethi iyakwamukela lokutfolakala kwetibhamu letinengi letingekho emtsetfweni nekuboshwa kwebasolwa labange-20 labatsintsekako kulokumbiwa kwetimbiwa letingekho emtsetfweni ngalesikhatsi kwentiwa luphenyo eStilfontein eNyakatfo Nshonalang
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the seizure of a firearms cache and the arrest of 20 suspects linked to illegal mining during an operation at a mineshaft in Stilfontein in North Wes

src_text: Ikhabhinethi icela bantfu baseNingizimu Afrika kutsi bachubeke basebentisane nema-ejensi etemtsetfo kucinisekisa kutsi kuba nemphumelelo emisebentini yekulwa nebugebengu esikhatsini lesitak Loku kutawutfumela umlayeto lonemandla wekutsi bugebengu abukhokheli, nekutsi tigebengu titawubanjwa bese tiyashushiswa ngaphandle kwekusaba noma kwekuvuna luhlangotsi
trg_text: Cabinet appeals to South Africans to continue working with law-enforcement agencies to ensure the success of future anti-crime operation This will send a strong message that crime does not pay, and that criminals will be arrested and prosecuted without fear or favou 6.

src_text: Temandla
trg_text: Energy

src_text: I-Eskom isandza kusayina tivumelwano tekucashisa teminyaka lenge-30 nebatjali timali labakhicita gezi labatimele labane kute bakhe umkhicito wemtsamo lomusha wetemandla langabulali simondzawo etiteshini iMajuba neTutuka eMpumalang Lokucashiswa kwalomhlaba kutawuheha lutjalomali lolulinganiselwa kutigidzigidzi letinge-R42.
trg_text: Eskom recently signed 30-year lease agreements with four independent power producer investors to construct new clean-energy generation capacity at Majuba and Tutuka power stations in Mpumalang The land leases will attract an estimated investment of about R40 billio

src_text: Labatjalimali labane
trg_text: The four investors

src_text: i-HDF Energy South Africa, i-Red Rocket SA, i-Sola Group ne-Mainstream Renewable Power Developments South Africa
trg_text: HDF Energy South Africa, Red Rocket SA, Sola Group and Mainstream Renewable Power Developments South Africa

src_text: batawungeta lokungenani ema-megawatts la-2000 kulegridi yagezi wavelonkh
trg_text: will contribute at least 2 000 megawatts to the national electricity gri

src_text: Lomkhicito wemtsamo lomusha kulindzeleke kutsi uchunywe kugridi yavelonkhe esikhatsini lesisemkhatsini kwetinyanga letinge-24 kuya kuletinge-36 kusuka ngembi kwekuvalwa kwetetimali, lokutawuya ngekugunyatwa ngumtsetfo wetesimondzawo, wekuhlelwa kwemhlaba kanye nangalokunye kuvumeleka kwemitsetf 7.
trg_text: The new generation capacity is expected to be connected to the grid within 24 to 36 months from financial closure, subject to environmental, land zoning and other regulatory approvals

src_text: Kutfolakala kwekudla
trg_text: Food security

src_text: Ikhabhinethi iyakwamukela kungenisa Ingcungcutsela ye-Agri SA yemnyaka we-2022 ePitoli mhla ti-14 Imphala 2022 ngaphasi kwalesihloko lesitsi:
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the hosting of the Agri SA Congress 2022 in Pretoria on 13 and 14 October 2022 under the theme:

src_text: Kulima Eveni Lakitsi .
trg_text: Growing Local .

src_text: LeNgcungcutsela yacocisana mayelana netintfo letifana nekwenta kutsi luhlelo lolukhulu lwetekulima lusebentele balimi bakuleli; sakhiwonchanti lesisimeme nekudla lokulinywa kulendzawo; kwenta simondzawo sakuleli sikhone kumelana nekukhicita kudla kwalapha kuleli esikhatsini lesitako; nekukhulisa emandla ebalimi bakuleli kute bakhone kwenta imikhicito yetintfo letilinywa lapha kuleli lakits
trg_text: The congress engaged on issues such as making agriculture masterplans work for local growers; sustainable infrastructure for locally grown food; making the local environment sustainable for local food production into the future, and strengthening food producers

src_text: Kuchubeka nekubeka embili kutfolakala kwekudla, Ikhabhinethi futsi iyakwemukela kwetfulwa kwesikhungo savelonkhe lesivimbela magciwane labanga tifo letitsatselanako i-National Biosecurity Hub, ngaphasi kweluhlelo lwe-Agricultural Bio-economy Innovation Partnership Programme, lokwentiwe Litiko Letesayensi Nekucamba kanye Neluhlelo Lwekusebentisana, libambisene neYunivesithi yasePitol Lesikhungo sitawusekela kuvikela, kunciphisa nekulawula tifo tetitjalo netetilwane, letitawuba neligalelo ekukhuliseni kukhicitwa kwekudla, ekutfolakaleni kwekudla kanye nentfutfuko lesimeme yetindzawo tasemaphandlen
trg_text: In further prioritising food security, Cabinet also welcomed the launch of the National Biosecurity Hub, by the Department of Science and Innovation's Agricultural Bio-economy Innovation Partnership Programme, in collaboration with the University of Pretori The hub will support the prevention, reduction and management of crop and animal disease, which will contribute to increased productivity, food security and sustainable rural developmen

src_text: Tincumo TeKhabhinethi1.
trg_text: Cabinet decisions1.

src_text: Kusayinwa Kwemculu Wekusabalalisa Lubumbano Lwemave Ase-Afrika (i-AU)
trg_text: Ratification of the Decentralisation Charter of the African Union (AU)

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ikuvumile kwetfulwa ePhalamnde kweMculu we-AU lomayelana Nekutiphatsa Netimiso Tekusabalalisa, Kuphatfwa Kwendzawo Yasekhaya Nekutfutfukiswa Kwayo Kute Ucinisekisw INingizimu Afrika isayine lomculu ngenyanga yeNgci 2021.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament the AU Charter on the Values and Principles of Decentralisation, Local Governance and Local Development for ratificatio South Africa signed the charter in August 2022.

src_text: Umculu Wekusabalalisa unika onkhe emave langemalunga inchubomgomo leyinkhombandlela lemayelana nekusabalalisa emandla nemisebenti kusukela kuhulumende wavelonkhe kuya kuletinye tinhlaka tahulumend Lomculu ukhuluma kakhulu ngekusabalalisa emandla ekuphatsa nemisebenti, ngenchubomgomo lemayelana nekuphatsa bohulumende basekhaya kanye nangekutfutfukisa indzawo yasekhay 2.
trg_text: The Decentralisation Charter provides a framework to all member states a guiding document on the decentralisation of powers and functions from national to other spheres of governmen The charter deals largely with the decentralisation of authority and functions, local governance framework and local development

src_text: Umkhandlu Wemave Emhlaba Wetekuphepha Kutetitimela Wemnyaka we-32 (i-IRSC)
trg_text: 32nd Annual International Railway Safety Council (IRSC)

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ivumile kutsi ubanjelwe kuleli umhlangano Wemnyaka We-IRSC eJozi kusuka mhla lu-1 kuya kumhla ti-6 Imphala 2023 ngaphasi kwalesihloko lesitsi:
trg_text: Cabinet approved the hosting of the 32nd Annual IRSC Meeting in Johannesburg from 1 to 6 October 2023 under the theme:

src_text: Kubumba kabusha tetitimela kuloMhlaba lote sicinisek
trg_text: Reshaping railways in an uncertain World .

src_text: I-IRSC iyinkhundla yemave emhlaba lehlanganisa bocwepheshe betekuphepha kutetitimela labavela kuwo onkhe emave emhlaba kute babelane ngelwati kute kutfutfukiswe tekuphepha kutetitimel
trg_text: The IRSC is an international forum that brings together railway safety professionals from all over the world to exchange experiences so as to improve railway safet

src_text: Njengelilunga le-IRSC, Umlawuli WaseNingizimu Afrika Wetekuphepha Kutetitimela lomcimbi wagcina kusingatsa lenkhundla kuleli ngemnyaka we-2015.
trg_text: As a member of the IRSC, South Africa s Railway Safety Regulator last hosted this forum in 201

src_text: Luhlaka Lweluhlelo Lwesakhiwonchanti Savelonkhe leti-2050 (i-NIP 2050) Sigaba se-2
trg_text: Draft National Infrastructure Plan 2050 (NIP 2050) Phase 2

src_text: Ikhabhinethi yavuma kutsi kushicilelwe kumiculu yahulumende luhlaka lwe-NIP 2050 yeSigaba-2 kute kucociswane ngalo nemmang Loluhlelo lunika sicondziso sekukhulisa nesekungeta imiklamo lehlanganisiwe yendlelalisu lahulumend
trg_text: Fifth Progress Report on the Implementation of the White Paper on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (WPRPD) 2020-2021 Cabinet approved the Fifth Progress Report on the Implementation of the WPRPD, which provides an update on the implementation of the WPRP The report covers inputs from national and provincial government department It provides updates on the policy implementation that include budget allocation

src_text: Loluhlaka libuka lemiklamo yendlelalisu nemigomo kutekuhlaliswa kwebantfu; kugezi wamasipala; kutemanti; kunkhukhuma; kutigitjelwa temmango; kutemfundvo; nakusakhiwonchanti setemphilo, kusakhiwonchanti lesidijithali, nakubugebengu nenkhohlakal
trg_text: It identifies the strategic projects in human settlements; municipal electricity; water; solid waste; passenger transport; education and health infrastructure; digital infrastructure, and crime and corruptio

src_text: Indlela loluhlelo lwakheke ngayo inika umbono lomayelana nendzawo lekufuneka isetjentwe, iniketa luhlolo lwesimo samanje, ichaza timo letimcoka lekufuneka tiphumelele futsi iyasho kutsi yini lekufuneka yenteke kute kupheleliswe lombon Ihlongota inchubo yekuphumelelisa lekufuneka itsatfwe kulomjikeleto weluhlelo lwekusebenta lweminyaka lemitsatf 4.
trg_text: The format of the plan provides a vision of the area to be tackled, offers an assessment of the current status, outlines the essential conditions for success and states what needs to be done to achieve the visio It proposes the implementation process to be taken over the three-year running cycle action plan

src_text: Luhlaka Lwavelonkhe Lwekufezekisa Kwenta Temisebenti Yahulumende Ibe Yebucwephesha
trg_text: National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Service

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ilivumile loLuhlaka Lwavelonkhe Lwekufezekisa Kwenta Temisebenti Yahulumende Ibe Yetebuchwephesh Loluhlakamsebenti lwashicilelwa kute kucociswane ngalo nemmango ngemnyaka we-2021.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Servic The framework was published for public consultation in 2021.

src_text: Loluhlakamsebenti luniketa imigomo lenetinsika letisihlanu letimayelana nekungenelela kute kwentiwe Temisebenti Yahulumende Ibe Yetebucwephesh Letinsika tifaka ekhatsi loko lekufuneka kwentiwe ngembi kwekucashwa nekukhetfwa kuTemisebenti Yahulumende; kuchazelwa ngemsebenti nekungeniswa kahle kancane kancane kute ube yincenye yebasebenti ngalokuphelele; kuhlela nendlela yekulawula kwenta umsebenti kwaloyo naloyo muntfu; kuchubeka nekufundza nekutfutfukiswa lokusezingeni lebucwepheshe, kanye nekukhula kulomsebenti lowentako kanye netigameko temsebent 5.
trg_text: The framework provides five pillars on interventions in professionalising the Public Servic The pillars include pre-entry recruitment and selection within the Public Service; induction and onboarding; planning and performance management; continuous learning and professional development, and career progression and career incidents

src_text: Tingucuko Kutimo Tekucashwa Kwebacondzisi Jikelele (ba-DG)
trg_text: Changes in the conditions of employment for Directors-General (DGs)

src_text: Ikhabhinethi iwuvumile umbiko lohlongota kutsi kube netindlela tekukhulisa emandla nemakhono abo-DG kuTemisebenti Yahulumend Lombiko ute netiphakamiso letimbalwa, letifaka ekhatsi sikhatsi sabo-DG sekuhlala kulowo msebenti kanye nekulawula ligunya lebalinikwe Sigungu Lesiphetse liye kulabo lababukene wekuphendvul
trg_text: Cabinet approved the report that proposes measures to strengthen the capacity and capability of the DGs in the Public Servic The report made several proposals,

src_text: Lombiko futsi uhlongote kutsi DG weLihhovisi laMengameli anikwe emandla ekuba Yinhloko Yetemisebenti Yahulumend Etifundzeni, lomsebenti utawentiwa bo-DG labasemahhovisini aboNdvunankhul Lombiko futsi uhlongote tindlela letitawulandzelwa matiko ekulawuleni emakhontileka abo-D
trg_text: The report also proposed that the DG in The Presidency will be designated as the Head of Public Administratio In the provinces, this function will be designated to the DGs in the offices of the Premier The report further proposed measures to guide departments on the management of contracts of DG

src_text: Luhlelo Lolubuyeketiwe Lwekulawula Kusebenta Kwabo-DG lusabuyeketwa kute lucondzaniswe naletingucuko lekuvunyelwene ngat
trg_text: The revised Performance Management System for DGs is being revised to align it with the approved change

src_text: Indvuna Lebambile Yetemisebenti Yahulumende Netekuphatsa, Umn Thulas Nxesi, utawubamba umhlangano webetindzaba kuleliviki lelitako kute achaze ngaLenchubomgomo Yavelonkhe Yekwenta Umsebenti letawenta kube neBucwephesha Kutemisebenti Yahulumende iphindze futsi ichaze ngaletingucuko lekuvunyelwene ngato kuletimo tekusebenta kwebo-D
trg_text: The Acting Minister of Public Service and Administration, Mr Thulas Nxesi, will next week convene a media briefing to outline the National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Service and also unpack the approved changes in the conditions of employment for DGs

src_text: Umbiko Wesihlanu Walosekwentiwe Ngekufezekiswa Kwemtsetfo Lohlongotwako Mayelana Nemalungelo Ebantfu Labanekukhubateka (i-WPRPD) Wemnyaka We-2020-2021
trg_text: Hosting of the Presidential Gender-Based Violence and Femicide (GBVF) Summit 2022

src_text: Ikhabhinethi iwuvumile Umbiko Wesihlanu Lomayena Nalosekwentekiwe Ekufezekisweni kwe-WPRPD, leniketa timemetelo ngekusetjentiswa kwe-WPRP Lombiko ufaka ekhatsi tetfulo letiniketwe ngematiko ahulumende wavelonkhe newesifundz Uniketa timemetelo letimayelana nekusetjentiswa kwetinchubomgomo letifaka ekhatsi kwesabelomal
trg_text: Cabinet noted the concerns raised by the public and resolved to review the Guide for Members of the Executiv This process will be handled by a neutral structure and once completed, the guide will be made public through the Department of Public Service and Administration s website: wwdpsgoz Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP) and JETP Investment Plan (JETP-IP)1

src_text: Umbiko wekucala walosekwentiwe wemnyaka washicilelwa ngemnyaka we-2017.
trg_text: The first annual progress report was published in 2017.

src_text: Lombiko lona wesihlanu uvunyiwe kutsi ufakwe kugazethi nekutsi ushicilelwe Litiko Labomake, Lelusha Nelebantfu Labanekukhubateka kutsi ushicilelwe kumiculu yahulumend
trg_text: This fifth progress report has been approved to be gazetted and published by the Department of Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities

src_text: Kuchitjelwa kweMbhalo 20(1) Wenhlangano Yekucedza Tonkhe tinhlobo Telubandlululo Lolubhekiswe Kubomake (i-CEDAW)
trg_text: Amendment to Article 20(1) of the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW)

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ikuvumile kutsi kutfunyelwe ePhalamnede sichibelo seMbhalo 20(1) se-CEDAW kute kutsi isayinw Lesichibelo sibonelela kutsi kungetwe sikhatsi semihlangano yelikomidi lelisebenta ngemibiko yemave langemalung
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the amendment to Article 20(1) of the CEDAW for ratificatio The amendments provide for an increased duration of the committee meetings that process the member states

src_text: INingizimu Afrika isayine lesivumelwano ngemnyaka we-1993 yabese iyasicinisekisa ngeNgongoni ngemnyaka we-1995.
trg_text: South Africa signed this convention in 1993 and subsequently ratified it in December 1995.

src_text: Lokutfunyelwa kwaso ePhalamende kuhlose kutsi kulungiswe lesivumelwano sakudzala lesacinisekiswa kute sibe nesichibelo kuMbhalo 20(1) walesivumelwan 8.
trg_text: The submission to Parliament seeks to align the previously ratified convention with the amendment to Article 20(1) of the convention

src_text: Sivumelwane Semhlaba Sekutsi Kuvunyelwe Ticu Temfundvo Letimayelana Netemfundvo Lephakeme
trg_text: Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ivume kutsi kutfunyelwe ePhalamende Sivumelwane kutsi Kuvunyelwe Ticu Temfundvo Letimayelana Netemfundvo Lephakeme kute ticinisekisw Uma seticinisekisiwe titawutfunyelwa Kunhlangano Yelubumbano Lwemave Emhlaba (i-UN) Yetemfundvo, Tesayensi Neyetemasiko bese iyasetjentiswa lapha ekhaya ngekulandzela Umtsetfo Wenchubomgomo Yavelonkhe Yeticu, yemnyaka we-2008 (Umtsetfo 67 wemnyaka we-2008).
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education for ratificatio Once ratified it will be deposited to the United Nations (UN) Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization and domestically enabled through the National Qualifications Framework Act, 2008 (Act 67 of 2008).

src_text: Lomhlangano Wemhlaba usungula timiso temhlaba kute kungabi nekuvuna luhlangotsi, kube sobala nekutsi kube nekuvumeleka lokungabandlululi kweticu Temfundvo Lephakem Uvumela kutsi ticu temave angaphandle tivumeleke kumave lamalunga e-UN la-193.
trg_text: The Global Convention establishes universal principles for fair, transparent and non-discriminatory recognition of higher education qualifications and qualification It allows for the recognition of foreign qualifications in 193 UN member states

src_text: Kukhishwa Kwetichibelo Kulomculu Loyinkhombandlela Yemalunga Esigungu Lesiphetse
trg_text: Withdrawal of the amendments to the Guide for Members of the Executive

src_text: Ikhabhinethi isivumile simemetelo lesentiwe nguMengameli ngeMsombuluko, ti-17 Imphala 2022 sekutsi kususwe letichibiyelo letentiwe kulomculu loyinkhombandlela Yemalunga Esigungu Lesiphetse, lophindze watiwe ngekutsi Libhukwana Letindvuna, lemnyaka we-2022
trg_text: Cabinet endorsed the announcement made by The Presidency on Monday, 17 October 2022 to withdraw the amendments made to the Guide for Members of the Executive, also called the Ministerial Handbook, for 2022.

src_text: Letichibelo letentiwe ngenyanga yaMabasa 2022 tibonelela kutsi kube nemandla langetiwe kulamanye emahhovisi eTindvuna letisebenta umsebenti wetikhundla letingetulu kwasiny Letichibelo betifuna kutsi Hulumende atsetse ngalokugcwele tindleko letimayelana nekuphakelwa kwagezi nemanti etindlini tembuso lekuhlala kuto emalunga esigungu lesiphets
trg_text: The amendments that were made in April 2022 provided for additional capacity to some of the offices of the Ministers who are responsible for more than one portfoli They also required the State to take over full responsibility for the costs associated with the provision of electricity and water to official residences occupied by members of the executiv

trg_text: After welcoming a presentation on the JETP and the JETP-IP, Cabinet endorsed the JETP-IP and expressed its appreciation of the detailed work undertaken to develop i 1

trg_text: The JETP-IP outlines the investments required to achieve the decarbonisation commitments made by the Government of South Africa while promoting sustainable development, and ensuring a just transition for affected workers and communitie 1

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ivumile kutsi kwetfulwe ePhalamende Umtsetfosivivinywa Wetemisebenti Yemikhumbi Wemnyaka We-2022 kute uchubeke usetjentw Lomtsetfosivivinywa ulungisa kabusha Umtsetfo Wetemisebenti Yemikhumbi, Wemnyaka We-1951.
trg_text: Cabinet has approved the submission of the Merchant Shipping Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processin The Bill overhauls the 70-year-old Merchant Shipping Act, 1951 (Act 57 of 1951).

src_text: Umhlangano Wavelonkhe WaMengameli Wabosomabhizinisi Labasakhasa (ema-SMME) kanye Nemifelandzawonye
trg_text: National Presidential Small, Micro and Medium Enterprises (SMME) and Cooperatives Summit

src_text: Litiko Lekutfutfukisa Emabhizinisi Lasakhasa, libambisane nebalingani balo lebakumkhakha lotimele, litawubamba Umhlangano Wema-SMME Wavelonkhe WaMengameli nemifelandzawonye eBraynston, eGauteng kusuka mhla ti-13 kuya kumhla ti-15 Lweti 2022.
trg_text: The Department of Small Business Development, in partnership with private-sector stakeholders, will host the National Presidential SMME and Cooperatives Summit in Bryanston, Gauteng from 13 to 15 November 2022.

src_text: Lomhlangano utawuhlanganisa ndzawonye bantfu labamcoka labakumkhakha wahulumende nalotimele kuloluchungechunge lwetemabhizinisi lasakhasa, kute kucociswane ngekutfola tindlela tekusebentisana letingakhulisa lomkhakh Labalindzelekile kutsi babe khona labatawudlala indzima bafaka ekhatsi emagatja etinhlangano tetemnotfo, labasebenta ngema-SMME, tifundziswa, labasebenta ngetinchubomgomo kanye netikhungo tekutfutfukisa tetimal
trg_text: The summit will deliberate on, amongst other issues, finding ways to accelerate actions and accountability from key departments and all the stakeholders that include civil society, the private sector and labou 3.

src_text: Lomhlangano futsi utawucocisana ngaLoluhlelo Lolukhulu Loluhlangene Lwavelonkhe Lwekutfutfukisa Emabhizinisi Lasakhasa, lolubonelela kutsi kube nenchubomgomo yendlelalisu letawunika umkhakha wema-SMME emandl Lomhlangano futsi kulindzeleke kutsi utfule Imiklomelo YaMengameli Yema-SMME Avelonkhe Emnyak 2.
trg_text: The summit will also discuss the National Integrated Small Enterprise Development Masterplan, which provides a strategic framework to strengthen the SMME secto The summit is also expected to introduce the Annual National Presidential SMME Awards

src_text: Ikhabhinethi ikholelwa ekutsini i-MTBPS yemnyaka we-2022 itawetfulwa yiNdvuna Yetetimali Enoch Godongwanea ngaLesitsatfu, mhla ti-26 Imphala 2022 iyincenye lemcoka yeluhlelo lwelwabiwomali yaseNingizimu Afrika loluvulekile nelekuphendvul
